page.title: 06More Principal Features
page.content: {The Bus Shelter, Hillesley,}is sited in the High Street, and is quite a focal point in the village.It is built of stone with a stone tiled roof. It was built in 1952 and has 2 short benches, one long one and two notice boards. The bus shelter was re-painted in April 1985. {The War Memorial,Hillesley,}is a tall stone pillar with a cross on top. It is sited on a grass triangle where the High Street meets Kingswood Road. A chain fence surrounds the triangle. On the memorial is the inscription 'To those who died for their country in the Great War 1914-1919'. {Jubilee Playing Field, Hillesley,}was given to the village to commemorate the Queens' Sliver Jubilee. It has a large grass playing area, a tarmac area suitable for netball, tennis or roller skating and swings and things.
